result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd L Boaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution.   State has 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.

Pay costs, DNA Surcharges, and supervisions fees for both counts.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment /Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
Psychological counseling and comply with any Mental Health Treatment plan. 
Defendant to be also seen by a psychiatrist if agent feel is necessary.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or using or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   
Participate in ICE (anger management).
Comply with orders in 13JC111.
Complete a parenting course.
No contact with Kariann Johnson unless she request and agent approves.
Defendant allowed transitioning to the Portage House programs, if appropriate, and Agent can get Defendant into programs.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent and by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
(redacted Juvenile name & rescanned JOC)

Court calls case at 10:14 a.m. Defendant Todd L Boaz in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Todd L Boaz in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have received and reviewed the PSI Report.  Atty Arendt states the corrections to PSI report.  ADA Cousins provides the Court and Atty Arendt a Victim Impact Statement.  ADA Cousins recommends W/H Sentence: 3 yrs Probation: Conditions as stated in the PSI on pages 18 & 19, exception would be 288 days conditional jail with 288 days pre-trial incarceration credit and be time served for the conditional jail sentence.  State request 30 days to prepare restitution order.
Atty Patrick Arendt concurs with agreement.
Defendant makes apologetic statements.

BTC:*****************PROBATION********
Ct 1:  W/H Sentence: 3 yrs Probations: 
Conditions:
288 days jail w/ credit 288 days  - time served
 Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or using or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Participate in ICE (anger management).
Comply with orders in 13JC111.
Complete a parenting course.
No contact with Kariann Johnson unless she request and agent approves.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
Psychological counseling and comply with any Mental Health Treatment plan. 
Defendant to be also seen by a psychiatrist if agent feel is necessary.
Defendant allowed transitioning to the Portage House programs, if appropriate, and Agent can get Defendant into programs.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent and by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Pay costs. 
Pay restitution. State has 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.

CT 2:  W/H Sentence: 3 yrs Probation.  Concurrent with Count 1: 
Conditions: 288 days jail w/ credit 288 days  current with count 1 - time served.
Comply with same conditions as stated in Ct 1. 
Pay costs.

ADA Cousins request clarifications: DNA surcharges on each count and jail time for both Counts.
BTC: DNA surcharges on each count and jail time, concurrent with Count 1 - 288 days credit - time served.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Todd L Boaz in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Todd L Boaz in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:10 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreeement.
State has filed an amended information, amending count 2. 
Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2.
State recommends withheld sentence, 3 yrs prob, payment of costs, aoda and comply, abs sob for alcohol and controlled substances, mental health assessment, ft empt, other counseling, no possession of dangerous weapons, provide DNA sample, restitution, no contact with victim unless request is filed, no pets, follow any chips orders, conditional jail, time served sentence. State requests a PSI.

Atty Arendt concurs.
There was an NGI plea entered, Court ordered an examination. The doctor did submit the findings back in February. Each party received a copy of the findings as well. Atty Arendt is withdrawing the NGI plea.

Atty Arendt addresses the Court. 

Atty Arendt has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 - amended

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 951.02 
Amended Count 2: 943.01(2)(d)

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

Atty Arendt addresses the Court regarding bond. 
Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding bond.

Court suggests a written stipulation regarding bond after the State is contacted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Status conference on February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State will be filing an information with the same counts.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY and a plea of NOT GUILTY BY DISEASE OR DEFECT.

Bond is ordered continued.

Attorney  Patrick Arendt appeared by video for Defendant Todd L Boaz. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Todd L Boaz appeared by video.

4:10 PM Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.
Atty Arendt is appearing with Defendant by video.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Atty Arendt has prepared a waiver and Defendant has signed it, has the waiver with him.
Atty Arendt will be filing the waiver with the Court.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 


State intends to file an information with the same charges in the criminal complaint.
Arraignment will be done on a different date.

Defense would like to have the arraignment.
Court questions Atty Arendt.

Parties will continue without an information at this time.

  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court who appears on behalf of Atty Patrick Arendt. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Raabe has not had time to review the complaint with his client. 
Atty Isherwood states correction. 
Court amends the complaint. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Raabe makes arguments to modify bond. 
Atty Isherwood makes arguments to the Court re: modifying the bond. 

BY THE COURT: 
Motion to modify the bond is denied at this time.  Any further arguments should be heard in front of Branch 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
No contact with his mother, his sister or his children and this is to be a condition of confinement as well. 
Follow any orders of the Juvenile Court.

Court calls case at 3:05 p.m. 
ADA Veronica Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of Mistreating animal resulting in death and causing harm to child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Isherwood recommends a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant is not currently employed.  He was previously employed in early December by Figi's. 
He is not currently on probation or parole. 
Atty Isherwood states additional information.  

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  01-13-2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
Court advises defendant to contact Public Defender. 

Atty Isherwood requests the no contact be a condition of confinement as well.
